decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed 22068_P4_10 Rev A, 22068_P4_20 Rev A, 22068_P4_31 Rev A, Noise Management Plan [by allplanning dated December 2023], PATRON NOISE IMPACT ASSESSMENT 19 SEPTEMBER 2023 1969-AF-00001-01 and Fire Safety Strategy. 22068 _ 47 Trinity Road, London SW17 7SD.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - All external materials used in the construction of the development hereby approved shall match the type, texture, tone, colour, size and profile of those detailed witihin the Application Form or used on the existing building and shall be retained permanently. 
Reason: In the interest of the appearance of the development and to safeguard visual amenity, in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 4 - The development permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out and operated in accordance with the approved Noise Management Plan [by allplanning dated December 2023] and PATRON NOISE IMPACT ASSESSMENT 19 SEPTEMBER 2023 1969-AF-00001-01.
The noise mitigation measures shall be retained as such.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan  coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework..
Condition : 5 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, details of the sound mitigation proposed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The submitted details shall include:
- Screen on first floor flat-roof area at a height of 1.0m to screen the first-floor windows of 47 Trinity Road.
- The acoustic absorption treatment to the wall beneath the open roof area.
The noise mitigation measures shall be retained as such.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan  coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework..
Condition : 6 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, an operational waste and recycling strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The submitted operational waste and recycling strategy shall include details of the arrangements for storage and collection of waste from the development. The measures detailed in the approved operational waste and recycling strategy shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development and operated and maintained in accordance with the approved operational waste and recycling strategy in perpetuity.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for waste storage in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 7 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of:
(a) [1000 - 2300] Mondays - Thursdays 
(b) [1000 - 2330] Friday - Sundays
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan  coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 8 - Prior to occupation of the development the windows in the roof lantern of the extension shall be installed as obscure-glazed and non-opening (fixed shut). The windows shall so be maintained and retained as such. The rear door shall only be used by staff/employees of the premises and opened to enter and exit and shall remain shut at all other times. The rear yard shall not be used by patrons at any point, shall be kept free of seating and retained as such.
Reason: To control noise disturbance, overlooking and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (adopted August 2023) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 9 - No amplified sound/music or speech shall be generated by the use hereby
approved so as to be audible at the nearest residential premises.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan.
Condition : 10 - The roof area of the development hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area and furthermore, no balustrades, railings or other means of enclosure or means of permanent access shall be erected on this area.
Reason: To control overlooking and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Alterations including erection of a single-storey rear extension to provide additional customer seating.
